    Developing something.

    post • links

    Design with Swift →

    By guezota July 31, 2014 Permalink Like Tweet +1

    Objective-C always felt like an alien language from the perspective of someone who’s never done iOS development. It’s bulky and long, but thanks to the expressive syntax and world-class documentation, I got used to it and even liked it. Still, that doesn’t change the fact that to new developers, it’s confusing and unfamiliar. Swift solves that. It’s a lot more approachable.

    When I first thought about actually doing something with my iOS developer’s annual fee and started looking for a way to get me started, everyone seemed to be pointing at Meng To and his amazing book. He had already announced the Swift chapter, and that took care of any doubt I might have had (I didn’t). A bit later the chapter is ready. Just like that, I have plans for this weekend.
